educationalInsights.title: Understanding Mosquito Breeding Sites
educationalInsights.content: Mosquitoes lay their eggs in stagnant water or moist environments. These sites vary from natural locations like ponds to artificial areas like discarded containers.

educationalInsights.title: Why Is It Important to Address Breeding Sites?
educationalInsights.content: Uncontrolled mosquito breeding can lead to health risks, environmental damage, and economic impact.

impact.details: Spread of diseases like dengue, malaria, and chikungunya.
Disruption of ecosystems caused by invasive mosquito species.
Increased medical expenses and productivity loss.

educationalInsights.title: How Can You Help Prevent Mosquito Breeding?
educationalInsights.content: Take actionable steps to minimize breeding sites in your area.
steps: Inspect Your Area Weekly: Check and clean water-holding items, such as buckets, pots, and old tires.
Cover and Store Properly: Keep water storage containers tightly covered.
Dispose of Trash Properly: Recycle or throw away containers that can collect water.
Drain and Dry: Remove standing water in plant saucers, drainage areas, and outdoor furniture.
Support Community Initiatives: Join local cleanup drives and mosquito awareness programs.

educationalInsights.title: Recognizing High-Risk Sites in Your Community
educationalInsights.content: Be aware of common breeding sites in your area to address them effectively.
riskSites: Sewage and Drainage Canals: Often neglected, these areas are perfect breeding sites.
Waste Disposal Sites: Trash and debris trap water, creating hidden risks.
Agricultural Fields: Irrigation can lead to temporary water accumulation.

educationalInsights.title: Fast Facts About Mosquito-Borne Diseases
educationalInsights.content: Learn about common diseases spread by mosquitoes and their impacts.

diseases.name: Dengue
diseases.details: Affects millions annually; symptoms include fever, rash, and joint pain.

diseases.name: Malaria
diseases.details: Caused by Plasmodium parasites, transmitted via mosquito bites.

diseases.name: Zika Virus
diseases.details: Can cause birth defects if contracted during pregnancy.

educationalInsights.title: Fun Fact
educationalInsights.content: Did you know? Female mosquitoes are the only ones that bite! They need blood to produce eggs, while male mosquitoes feed on nectar.
